archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before reproducing or quoting from any materials, in whole or in part, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Clara Louise Schiefer Diary, Special Collections Research Center, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Special Collections Research Center on 02/21/2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessioned and minimally processed by Ute Schechter, Warren E. Burger Archivist, in March 2009. Further rehousing by Emily Eklund, SCRC staff, in April 2010.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: In 1933, Clara Louise Schiefer was a student at Brighton high school in Rochester, NY. Further information about this individual or organization may be available in the Special Collections Research Center Wiki: http://scrc.swem.wm.edu/wiki/index.php/Clara Louise Schiefer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Diary, 1933, of Clara Louise Schiefer, Rochester, N.Y. The following description was provided by the seller: "1933 handwritten diary of Clara-Louise Schiefer who had lived on Westland Ave. in Rochester, NY. Lots of memorabilia stuck in between the pages in regards to that day's entry. Some of the memorabilia items are: Vintage 1933 Halloween invitation to a party on Grosvenor Rd; School football photo of Brighton High School team; newspaper clippings, etc. Ms. Schiefer toured Germany and Switzerland in the summer of 1933 and writes about her trip.
